root.title: AI Applications
root.content:
Real-World AI Applications

Artificial Intelligence is not just a theoretical concept; it's actively used in many fields to solve complex problems and create new possibilities.

quiz.question: Which of these is NOT a common application of AI?
Recommendation engines, like those on Netflix or Spotify, are a common application of AI in which sector?

healthcare.title: Healthcare
healthcare.content:
AI in Healthcare

AI helps in diagnosing diseases earlier and more accurately (e.g., analyzing medical images), discovering new drugs, and personalizing treatment plans for patients.

finance.title: Finance
finance.content:
AI in Finance

In the financial sector, AI is used for algorithmic trading, fraud detection, credit scoring, and providing personalized financial advice through robo-advisors.

entertainment.title: Entertainment
entertainment.content:
AI in Entertainment

Recommendation engines on platforms like Netflix and Spotify are powered by AI. It's also used in video games for creating intelligent non-player characters (NPCs) and for special effects in movies.

autonomous-vehicles.title: Autonomous Vehicles
autonomous-vehicles.content:
Autonomous Vehicles

Self-driving cars use a combination of AI techniques, including computer vision to perceive the environment, sensor fusion to understand it, and reinforcement learning to make driving decisions.

nlp.title: Natural Language Processing
nlp.content:
Natural Language Processing (NLP)

Enabling computers to understand and generate human language. Click to explore applications like translation and sentiment analysis.

computer-vision.title: Computer Vision
computer-vision.content:
Computer Vision

Teaching computers to 'see' and interpret the visual world. Click to explore tasks like image classification and object detection.

generative-ai.title: Generative AI
generative-ai.content:
Generative AI

A class of AI that can create new and original content, such as images, text, and music. Click to explore models like LLMs and Diffusion Models.
